title: feat: add tui directly into dioxus mainline
feat: memoize useref by tracking mutations
body:
This PR allows userefs to be memoized by comparing their shared slots and internal mutation tracker.

This means use_ref can be passed into child components and be memoized if the write histories match up.

title: Docs: actually finish all of the documentation.
body:
Almost there!

I also totally forgot I started on this in #289 . That PR will need to be merged into this one.

title: Fixed Document
Make use_state a single value again
body:
This PR is a middle ground between the original UseState and the new react UseState. It doesn't implement copy (so you can call clone for async) but it *is* a single value - which should be clearer.

It does introduce some more indirection (double asterisk or .get() when trying to access the underlying value).

I think we lose some ergonomics but we can some consistency and clarity.

title: feat: canoncialize assets for macOS, Windows, and Linux
body:
This PR adds the right relative pathing for assets when bundled through cargo-bundle.

It's never been this easy to include an image in your Rust `.app`! :)

I don't have any other machine than a mac box so I can't test alternate implementations.

https://crates.io/crates/directories

- [x] macOS

These targets do not provide a straightforward way of bundling assets. I've opted to make it the asset dir configurable instead.
- [ ] windows
- [ ] linux (rpm)
- [ ] linux (deb)

Fixing this warning when I try to compile

warning: function `App` should have a snake case name
 --> src/main.rs:7:4

7 | fn App(cx: Scope) -> Element {

Also changing edition from 2018 to 2021

title: docs: add `deny(missing_docs)` is many more places
Disable reload context menu in production
body:
Webview will never get custom context menus (the thing when you right click), so it's up to app authors to implement their own context menus. A library for making that easier will be very helpful to the Dioxus ecosystem.

Anyways, this PR adds an initialization script in release mode that disables the context menu altogether, since having a right click menu that *just* shows reload is probably not super helpful to most users.

We weren't pinging the window to wake up after the initial rebuild - which we do after every *new* edit is generated.

title: feat: integrate fermi into the main repo
body:
This PR adds fermi: https://github.com/dioxusLabs/fermi our prototype global state management solution built on the concept of state atoms.

The Fermi pattern fits into Rust pretty well, so I don't have any issue taking fermi on as the "blessed" way of global state management for Dioxus apps. By including Fermi into Dioxus main, we can teach fermi in our main docs - getting new users up and running faster than having to hunt for a new library.

However, it's locked behind a feature flag, so you do need to go out of your way to enable it.

title: fix unnecessary div
body: This PR removes the `div` element that was wrapped around children of the router. This could confuse people and throw css styles off.

body: If they aren't the same then Cargo cannot resolve a working version for some reason.

title: Update to wry 0.13; support IPC, devtool, and feature flags
body:
First of all: Thank you for this amazing project!
I had already slightly more fun with this than with tauri itself, even though it stands on the shoulders of it (wry, tao).

I know it's a lot at once, but the wry 0.13 upgrade led me down a rabbit hole.

What changes:
- general dependency updates as much as possible (not only wry)
- switch from RPC to IPC handler, fix message (de)serialization
- modularize some code pieces
- adjust module/function/struct/enum visibility where it made sense (not all need to be pub)
- general cleanups

If something is not to your liking or you want something split up differently, I can try to cut separate PRs.

Note: I tested it with some examples and a local project, all on a Win10 machine.

title: Transparent window means transparent WebView
body:
Hi,

Small contribution here. When creating a transparent Window, shouldn't it also set the `WevView` to be transparent automatically ? This is what this PR is about.

Unfortunately, I am wondering if someone somewhere would need the window to be transparent, but not the `WevView`. If that's the case, then this solution won't do...but really, why would someone need that kind of feature ?

Have a nice day!

We had a regression in a recent commit that removed prevent default in all desktop cases.

This PR fixes that, re-enabling out-linking.

Fixes #215 .

TSC was generating too modern of code that carried over into the current version. This PR removes class attributes to adhere to es6 (the latest spec we adhere to).

title: feat: use serde-wasm-bindgen crate for speedup

title: feat: auto cancel tasks when scopes are dropped
body:
Currently, infinitely running features just leak. This PR auto cancels any future still running when a component is unmounted. 

The "right" way to handle cancellation in futures is through the `drop` pattern on hooks, however, this PR is meant to prevent memory leaks for components that always spawn new infinite poll tasks on mount.

title: Improve test speed in the CI
body:
I modified the Makefile a bit so that it doesn't compile on every crate. Instead, it builds first then runs the tests (eventually build what is required for the tests). With this in place, tests in CI take much less time to proceed.
Added also a separate test in the Makefile will test with proper configuration for runtime tests.

title: Feat: abstract the router on a per-platform basis and add docs
body:
This PR adds docs to the router and makes it possible to work locally.

The local router is implemented simply as a list of strings with a configurable max stack.

I would like to add deep linking through something like "ondeeplink" but that won't make it into this PR unfortunately.

title: fix ci test workflow
body: There is some issue with running tests from CI Workflow.

title: fix: remove code generation entirely
body:
It's a nice idea to have tsc generate our js binding files, but it leads to weird changes in PRs and noticeably slows down compilation.

This PR moves the binding code into the jsinterpreter crate so we can service both desktop and web from the same crate and same single `.js` file.

It seems that other projects that use bindings like this just write all their bindings in JS with heavy linting, so that's what we're going to follow until it becomes impossible.

Also, as a side-effect, we've fixed #173

body: This PR adds prevent_default (and a few other style attributes) onto the svg namespace to solve #197

Should be more reliable.

title: fix: dioxus web prevents default in nested targets
body:
this commit fixes an issue where we used the event target to prevent default even if the target element wasn't an event handler.


fixes #157

title: fix: nodes being unmounted when used in highly nested contexts
body:
This PR fixes #179 and an additional bug that @t1m0t found regarding state consumption in highly nested shared-node contexts.

Instead of the custom fiber implementation, this PR is choosing to switch back to a traditional recursive approach and then building fibers on top of rust's future infrastructure instead.

title: Overhaul async hooks: use_future, use_coroutine, use_effect (new)
body:
This PR overhauls
- [x] use_future to include a dependency array through some very clever rust trait magic (!)
- [x] use_coroutine to be designed explicitly for long-running async tasks
- [x] use_effect as a flavor of use_future that doesn't cause re-renders

body: Most users who want to build a Dioxus app *also* want stacktraces on panics. This PR just adds that by default, improving the onboarding DX for users so they can actually see *why* their app panicked.

title: feat: remove dioxus id on non-event elements
body: This PR adds "dom climbing" in JS so we don't need to generate a dioxus ID for every element. This speeds up dom patching significantly (+15%) and is overall cleaner.

This PR moves separates out the rsx macro and its infrastructure to allow use in an rsx autoformatter and accompanying vscode extension.

This will be part of our 0.1.8 release train alongside the router, optional props, better docs, and more.

title: Update ZH_CN.md
body: fixed some grammatical mistake.

title: Hooks: Change UseState to be like react's use_state
body:
This PR modifies `use_state` to return (value, set_value) just like in React. This should make usestate easier to learn and easier to work with (direct matching, if/then/eq, etc). 

More advanced usecases can use `use_ref` instead.

This is a very-much-breaking change - so the old UseState has been saved as "use_slot" with a deprecated tag, which we'll remove in the next release.

title: feat: unify web and desktop interpreter with the same typescript codebase
body:
This PR unifies the web and desktop interpreter so we only have one codebase to maintain for all JS targets.

It also moves all Dom manipulation into JS which has some light performance improvements.

It also sets us up a TypeScript build so we can strongly type the interpreter code now - which has fixed a few bugs.

closes #22 

Would also make any future changes to the interpreter code easier to maintain since they're only in one place

title: Flatten optional prop attributes
body:
This PR flattens the attributes provided to us by https://github.com/idanarye/rust-typed-builder

So instead of `#[props(setter(strip_option)]`, it would just be `#[props(strip_option)]`.

cc @autarch
